body:
Part of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29329

http://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/


Here's what needs to be done to close out this issue: 

- [x] [the module docs](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/) act like this is about `*const T`/`*mut T`, but it's really about common functions that work with them.
- [x] [`copy`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.copy.html) could link to `memmove` somewhere.
- [x] [`copy_nonoverlapping`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.copy.html) should link to `memcpy`. Both of these functions should talk more about what "overlapping" means here.
- [x] [`drop_in_place`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.drop_in_place.html) needs links and examples
- [ ] [`read`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.read.html) needs to explain why and where you should use it, as well as linking some stuff.
- [x] [`read_volitile`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.read_volatile.html) needs links
- [x] [`replace`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.replace.html) should link to `mem::replace`, and justify its unsafety better.
- [x] [`swap`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.swap.html) needs to split out its summary from its description, link to `mem::swap`, and get an example.
- [x] [`write`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.write.html) needs to explain when and where to use it, and to link some types
- [x] [`write_bytes`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.write_bytes.html) needs to better justify itself, link `memset`, and move that out of its summary line.
- [x] [`write_volatile`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/ptr/fn.write_volatile.html) needs to link `read`.
